block.p: Julie Fisher Jones, a daughter of Florieta Fisher Vest of Berry, Ky., and the late George A. Jones, was married yesterday to Richard Edward Lam, the son of Juliette Gibson Lam and Dick Lam of New York. The Rev. Richard Leonard, a Unitarian Universalist minister, performed the ceremony at All Souls Unitarian Church in New York.

Mrs. Lam, 34, is a marketing analyst for American Express in New York. She graduated from Morehead State University in Kentucky and received a certificate in acting from the National Shakespeare Conservatory in New York. Her mother owns Spring Acres Farm, a Black Angus farm in Berry. Her father was an entomologist and a research specialist in the College of Agriculture at the University of Kentucky at Lexington.

Julie Fisher Jones, a daughter of Florieta Fisher Vest of Berry, Ky., and the late George A. Jones, was married yesterday to Richard Edward Lam, the son of Juliette Gibson Lam and Dick Lam of New York. The Rev. Richard Leonard, a Unitarian Universalist minister, performed the ceremony at All Souls Unitarian Church in New York.

Mrs. Lam, 34, is a marketing analyst for American Express in New York. She graduated from Morehead State University in Kentucky and received a certificate in acting from the National Shakespeare Conservatory in New York. Her mother owns Spring Acres Farm, a Black Angus farm in Berry. Her father was an entomologist and a research specialist in the College of Agriculture at the University of Kentucky at Lexington.

Mr. Lam, 35, owns the Lotus Capital Group, a real estate investment company in Hoboken, N.J. His mother works in New York as a senior vice president for interiors and a director of Helmuth, Obata & Kassabaum, an architecture and interior design company. His father owns Lam Associates, a consulting firm in New York that represents Chinese companies in the United States.
